stance_1: I eat meat at almost every meal
stance_2: I love the taste of meat
justification: The enjoyment of meat's taste directly supports eating it frequently, as stated by the interviewee.

stance_1: I eat meat at almost every meal
stance_2: I try to have some balance
justification: Frequent meat consumption is in tension with the stated attempt to have balance, reflecting an explicit acknowledgment of excess.

stance_1: I eat meat at almost every meal
stance_2: I realize meat is not always healthy
justification: The recognition that meat is not always healthy conflicts with eating it at almost every meal.

stance_2: I realize meat is not always good for animals
justification: Frequent meat eating implicitly conflicts with the realization that it is not always good for animals.

justification: Frequent meat eating implicitly conflicts with the realization that it is not always good for the environment.

stance_1: I eat meat at almost every meal
stance_2: Meat eating is a habit in my family
justification: Eating meat frequently is explicitly described as a family habit, reinforcing the behavior.

stance_1: I eat meat at almost every meal
stance_2: My family eats similar meals to me
justification: The interviewee and their family both eating similar meals with frequent meat reinforces the behavior.
